flawed_nl_solution:
First subtract the 12 confiscated firecrackers from the original number: 48 firecrackers - 12 firecrackers = <<48-12=36>>36 firecrackers
Then multiply this number by 1/6 to find how many were defective: 36 firecrackers * 1/6 = <<36*1/6=216/1>>216/1 firecrackers
Then subtract the defective firecrackers to find how many were good: 36 firecrackers - 216/1 firecrackers = <<36-216/1=-180>>-180 firecrackers
Then divide this number in half to find how many firecrackers Jerry set off: -180 firecrackers / 2 = <<-180/2=-90>>-90 firecrackers
#### -90

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 6, not 216/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
